description: Core facts and rules for securities and financial markets.

facts.finance.securities.definition: A security is a tradable financial asset, including stocks, bonds, and derivatives.
facts.finance.securities.stock.definition: A stock represents fractional ownership in a corporation.
facts.finance.securities.bond.definition: A bond is a fixed-income instrument representing a loan from an investor to a borrower.
facts.finance.securities.sp500.definition: The S&P 500 is a stock market index tracking the 500 largest publicly traded companies in the United States.
facts.finance.securities.derivative.definition: A derivative is a financial contract whose value is derived from an underlying asset.
facts.finance.risk.definition: Financial risk is the probability of a loss resulting from market exposure.
facts.finance.securities.regulation.sec: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is the primary regulatory body for securities in the United States.
facts.finance.securities.ipo.definition: An Initial Public Offering (IPO) is the process by which a private company offers shares to the public for the first time.
